result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case in court for a plea and sentencing.  Defense requests an adjournment.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.

Defendant Jeffrey J Makowski in court with Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for bail hearing.  The bail hearing was held in person.    Bail motion by State argued and GRANTED in PART by the Court for the reasons stated on the record.    All conditions remain the same and Court order the defendant to REPORT to Justice Point after court today. 
The Court Order Scram bracelet ordered to monitor defendant maintains absolute sobriety.
 No driving without a valid license.
The Court scheduled the matter for plea and sentencing hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court will address bail on May 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.  All parties MUST APPEAR IN PERSON.  Parties notified.
Received and Filed:  State's Notice of Motion and Motion to Increase Bail.

Defendant Jeffrey J Makowski in court with Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris; both appear by video.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed.

Defendant Jeffrey J Makowski not in court, defendant in custody.  John Daniel Flynn appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5. ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by SCRAM and portable breathalyzers.

Defendant Jeffrey J Makowski in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant Jeffrey J Makowski in custody.  Anthony J Moore appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jeffrey J Makowski appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.   Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 3. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
